text: Brendan Rogers (born February 25, 1968) is a retired professional Canadian football linebacker and defensive back who played for nine years in the Canadian Football League (CFL). He was drafted in the fourth round, 32nd overall by the Winnipeg Blue Bombers in the 1991 CFL Draft. He played in five seasons with the Blue Bombers and tied a CFL record in 1994 for most special teams tackles in a single game with seven. Rogers played in four Grey Cup championship games, winning twice with the Toronto Argonauts in 1996 and 1997. He finished his career with the Saskatchewan Roughriders and, as of 2019, is third all-time in career special teams tackles with 176. He played college football for the Eastern Washington Eagles. ==References== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian football linebackers Category:Canadian football defensive backs Category:Sportspeople from Vancouver Category:Players of Canadian football from British Columbia Category:Toronto Argonauts players Category:Winnipeg Blue Bombers players Category:Eastern Washington Eagles football players
title: Brendan Rogers
